questions.text: A 27-year-old woman has suffered a gunshot wound to her mid abdomen. After examining the patient's angiogram, a trauma surgeon locates the source of bleeding from pairs of veins that typically terminate in the same vein. Which of the following veins are damaged?
questions.correct_answer: D. Left and right hepatic veins

questions.text: A 65-year-old CEO of a MNC received a severe blow on his head that caused a depressed fracture of his frontal bone. He was admitted in the hospital and discharged after 72 hours of observation. He joined his duty but in a few days the office staff noticed that CEO’s social behaviour has changed dramatically. He no more dresses himself properly and lacks initiative and drive. He also lacked inhibition and one day he was seen urinating in the dustbin of his office. Which part of the brain is most likely affected?

A 22-year-old male presents with occasional headaches. On examination, several pigmented spots on his trunk are seen with few rubbery cutaneous tumors on his neck. The cells composing these skin tumors most likely originated from which of the following structures?

A 45-year-old male presents with left arm clumsiness. Physical examination reveals motor weakness and increased muscle tone in the left arm. Specifically, with passive extension of the left arm there is initial resistance then sudden release when maximum extension is reached. Pathology within which of the following brain structures is most likely responsible?
A patient is unable to prevent anterior displacement of the femur on the tibia when the knee is flexed. Which of the following ligaments is most likely damaged?
A 36-year-old woman received a first-degree burn on her neck, arm, and forearm from a house fire. Which of the following skin structures or functions is most likely damaged or impaired?

The core body temperature of an experimental animal was raised from 98 degrees F to 106 degrees F by passive heating. Eventually, his body temperature dropped to 99 degrees F. What is the gain of the temperature control system in this animal?

A 73-year-old man comes to the emergency department complaining of chest pain, shortness of breath on exertion, and syncope. The patient has poorly managed hypercholesterolemia and a 10-year history of hypertension. Physical examination:- Temp- 37°C, Pulse- 85/min, Respiratory rate- 18/min, BP- 100/75 mm Hg. A systolic murmur is present, loudest over the aorta and peaking at mid systole. Palpitation of the carotid upstroke reveals a pulse that is both decreased and late relative to the apical impulse. Palpation of the chest reveals an apical impulse that is laterally displaced. Lungs are clear, and there are no rales. ECG: Left axis deviation but no abnormalities in the ST segment. Chest radiography: Enlarged left ventricle and calcification of the aortic valve. Doppler ultrasonography: A greatly increased velocity of flow during the systolic portion of the cardiac cycle. The left atrium and left ventricle chambers are enlarged, and left ventricular hypertrophy is present. Cardiac enzymes: CK-MB, troponin I, and myoglobin levels are normal. Which of the following PV loops corresponds with the condition described above? Abnormal loops are in red.

A 58-year-old woman is referred to an endocrinologist due to high calcium levels found during treatment for a fracture of her femur. The patient’s femur was fractured at the midshaft by a compression. The injury should not have been severe enough to break the bone. During treatment, the patient was noted to have high calcium levels and was referred for further evaluation. Physical examination reveals the following:- T 37°C, P 80/min, R 15/min, BP 116/76 mm Hg, BMI 26. The patient appears healthy and exercised regularly before the injury. The left femur is immobilized, and the injury appears to be healing well. Plasma analysis: ? Serum calcium: 14.2 mg/dL ? Serum phosphorus (inorganic): 2.1 mg/dL ? PTH levels: 2200 pg/mL Which of the following is not seen in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Increased renal conversion of 25- hydroxycholecalciferol to 1,25- dihydroxycholecalciferol

options.label: B
options.text: Increased reabsorption of calcium in DCT

options.label: C
options.text: Increased reabsorption of inorganic phosphorus in the PCT

questions.correct_answer: C. Increased reabsorption of inorganic phosphorus in the PCT

questions.text: A 20-year-old man is brought to the emergency department after camping in the winter with some friends. He became cold and wet during a rainstorm during the night and, in the morning, his friends had difficulty waking him. Physical examination:- Temp 32°C (rectal), Pulse 50/min, Respiratory rate 8/min, BP 90/70 mm Hg, BMI 26. The patient is conscious but confused. His skin is pale, and the lips, fingers, and toes are cyanotic and cold. Corneal reflexes are diminished. The patient is shivering uncontrollably and has difficulty speaking. ECG shows a sinus bradycardia. Which of the following is not a major physiological mechanism in adults to diminish heat loss or enhance heat gain when the ambient temperature is lower than body temperature?

A 45-year-old man comes to his physician complaining of a drooping eyelid and facial twitching on the left side of his face. He first noticed the symptoms about 6 hours ago, but they have continued to worsen. He is now having trouble tasting and is drooling from the left corner of his mouth. The patient has extreme left-sided facial weakness and paralysis. He is unable to blink his left eye. The patient has not had any neurologic problems in the past, although he did have the flu 3 weeks ago. Vital signs: T 38.2°C, P 80/min, R 18/min, BP 120/76 mm Hg. Output from what region of the motor cortex is no longer reaching the facial muscles?

options.label: A
options.text: Medial portions of the left hemisphere motor cortex

options.label: B
options.text: Lateral portions of the left hemisphere motor cortex

options.label: C
options.text: Medial portions of the right hemisphere motor cortex

options.label: D
options.text: Lateral portions of the right hemisphere motor cortex

questions.correct_answer: D. Lateral portions of the right hemisphere motor cortex

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman comes in for her regular check-up and complains about having a constant thirst and getting up frequently in the night to urinate. The patient has a history of high blood pressure. Her blood pressure has remained high regardless of medications prescribed or dosage. Vital signs: Temp- 37°C, Pulse- 85/min, Resp rate- 17/min, BP 145/110 mm Hg, BMI 32. Basic metabolic panel: Glucose: 95 mg/dL (normal: 70-110 mg/dL) Calcium: 9.2 mg/dL (normal: 8.4 to 10.2 mg/dL) Sodium: 146 mEq/L (normal: 136 to 145 mEq/L) Chloride: 100 mEq/L (normal: 95-105 mEq/L) Potassium: 3.2 mEq/L (normal: 3.5 to 5.0 mEq/L) Plasma aldosterone (recumbent): 25 ng/dL (normal: 2-16 ng/dL) Plasma renin activity: 0.8 ng/mL/hr (normal: 1.9 to 3.7 ng/mL/hr) 143. The decreased plasma renin activity is due to which of the following?
A 45 year old male is chronic alcoholic for past 15 years. He has tendency to faint often. His skin is dry and itchy. Following metabolic adaptation are seen in chronic alcoholism except?

options.label: C
options.text: Accumulation of fat in the liver

questions.text: DNA can be fragmented using restriction endonuclease enzyme. Fragments of different size can be separated by a technique called electrophoresis. Which among the following fragments will be found maximally towards the negative pole during DNA gel electrophoresis?

Aerobic and anaerobic glycolysis differ in terms of energy production and end product which is formed. In addition to glucose there are many other carbohydrates as well which produce ATP by using steps of glycolysis. Which of the yields 3 molecules of ATP under an-aerobic metabolism?
Anaplerotic and cataplerotic reaction need to be in balanced form for maintaining the homeostasis of metabolism. Which of the following is most abundant anaplerotic reaction in mammal?

options.label: A
options.text: Conversion of pyruvate to lactic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Conversion of pyruvate to acetyl co A

questions.correct_answer: B. Conversion of pyruvate to oxaloacetate

questions.text: Vitamins are micronutrients which are mostly required from outside. There are few exception to it. Which of the following vitamin is synthesized from an amino acid in vivo in the body by humans?

A 56-year-old reports reduced exercise tolerance over the past 5 years. In the past year he has noted chest pain after ascending a flight of stairs. He smokes 2 packs of cigarettes per day. On examination he has a blood pressure of 155/95 mm Hg. His body mass index is 30. Laboratory findings include a total serum cholesterol of 245 mg/dL with an HDL cholesterol of 22 mg/dL. Which of the following abnormalities is he most likely to have?

A 5 year child presents with diminished vision in the left eye. Physical examination reveals multiple hyperpigmented patches all over body. An imaging suggests there is a tumor in the eye. A microscopic examination of the tumor shows pleomorphic cells with prominent nucleoli and a black coloured intracellular pigment. Genetic analysis shows the child has an inherited mutation leading to such lesions. Which of the following cellular pathogenesis is leading to increased cancer in this child?

options.label: A
options.text: Inability to stop cell cycle at G1S check point

options.label: C
options.text: In ability to detect DNA errors

questions.correct_answer: D. A nucleotide excision repair abnormality

questions.text: A 35 year old woman presents with nodule in front of neck, FNAC is suggestive of papillary carcinoma of thyroid, her elder brother was diagnosed of colon cancer at the age of 45, her cousin also had a renal cell carcinoma at the age of 55 years. Her mother had breast carcinoma at 48 years. which of the following explains the increased risk of cancer in these people?

A 48 year old lady presents with persistent cough for last 4 months, which is not controlled with over the counter anti tussive. The cough is dry and is not associated with sputum. She had few episodes of epistaxis in the last few months but she insists that is not the major problem, Examination shows few purpuric rashes on skin, the bridge of the nose is depressed and auscultation shows focal areas of crepitations bilaterally. CT chest shows multiple infiltrated in the lungs bilaterally. Hb 10g/dL, TLC is 15000, Platelet count 1.8L/ cu.mm, CRP is 15, ESR is 35/1st hour, Urine Dipstick shows Protein 2+, microscopy is awaited. A biopsy from the lung is as shown in the image. Which of the following investigation is likely to be present in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: A culture positive for Mucor mycosis

options.label: C
options.text: A Sputum positive for TB PCR

options.label: D
options.text: A linear pattern on IF on kidney biopsy

questions.text: A 55 year diabetic patient on insulin presents with severe abdominal pain, fever. Physical examination shows diffuse guarding of abdomen. Temperature 38.4, pulse 102, BP 110/70, the patient appears to be flushed and multiple patechaie throughout the body. Clinically you are suspecting a perforation peritonitis leading to sepsis and DIC secondary to diabetes and want to treat the patient accordingly. You are asked to draw samples for CBC, D-Dimers, blood grouping cross matching, blood culture, Blood sugar and lactate levels. Which of the following vaccutainers and in which order (from left to right) you would be drawing blood? (Choose Option From Image)

A 10 year old boy is having fever and arthralgia for last 5 days, temperature is 101 F, pulse 88, BP 120/82, clinically oral mucosa appears dry. He had an episode of epistaxis after he tried to remove the secretions from the nose which stopped on its own without any medical treatment. Antibodies to NS1 antigen is positive. Platelet count is 15000/cu.mm, TLC is 7000. What is the next line of management?

options.label: A
options.text: Emergency platelet transfusion with fluids and antipyretics

questions.text: Parents of a 3 year child have notices a vague lump in their 3 year child’s left testes. Clinical examination shows both the testes have descended normally and there is a firm swelling in the left testis. USG confirms features suggestive of a neoplastic lesion. An Orchidectomy was performed. And the histology is as shown in the image. The tumor cells were negative for cytokeratin and leucocyte common antigen but positive for desmin. What is the likely diagnosis?
Immunohistochemical analysis from a neoplasm shows cells are positive for CD45 (LCA), CD3, Cd5, CD10 and TdT. Which of the following would be most likely clinical presentation of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: A 4 year child, with high grade fever and leucocytosis

options.label: B
options.text: A 55 year male with epistaxis and a nasal polyp

options.label: C
options.text: A 15 year child with mediastinal mass

options.label: D
options.text: A 32 year old with cervical lymphadenopathy

questions.correct_answer: C. A 15 year child with mediastinal mass

questions.text: A 48 year old woman presents with easy fatigue for the last 1 year. She has been taking oral iron, B12 and multivitamin tablets with no improvement. She has no altered sensation or any motor deficits. Neurological examination is normal Peripheral blood examination as shown in the image. A serum B12 levels 230pg/ml (normal 200-900) and folate levels 1ng/ ml ( normal 4-20 ng/ml). Patient was put on oral folate as a part of treatment. Which of the following is expected in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: No resolution of anemia due to folate trap

options.label: B
options.text: Resolution of anemia but patients developing parasthesia

options.label: D
options.text: Resolution of anemia and increase in B12 levels

questions.correct_answer: B. Resolution of anemia but patients developing parasthesia

questions.text: An internare transfusing whole blood to an 48 year old woman who is about to undergo hysterectomy for fibroids. Her vitals are normal to begin with, 15 minutes into transfusion she develops urticaria and rashes, intern immediately stop transfusion and administers IM antihistaminics and is waiting for the patient to respond. However the patient now presents with difficulty to breathe, slurred speech, and a heavy voice, his BP is no 100/70. What is the best next line of management?

A 5 year boy presents with fever and rashes on the cheek and itching for 2 days. Examination shows there are blisters on the skin containing clear fluid. He was prescribed paracetamol, antihistaminic and a calamine lotion to be applied on the blisters. 5 days later although the fever has subsided the child has red painless non itchy spots as seen in the image throughout the body. Although his vitals were normal a CBC was performed now shows a TLC 11000, Hb 12 g/dL, Platelet count 38000/cu.mm What is the likely explanation? Which of the following is likely diagnosis?

A 32 year lady presents with a lump in right breast. Examination shows the lump is hard adherent to the skin. Since her mother also has history of breast cancer a genetic test for inherited mutation comes out to be positive for BRCA-1. Which of the following is true about the assay of her breast tumor?

A 26 year old presents with bleeding per rectum, colonoscopy shows few polypoidal masses in the colon which do not have a definitive stalk. A biopsy was performed from one of the lesion is as shown in the image. The patient family history of cancer in mother having endometrial carcinoma. You start suspecting a familial cancer syndrome due to an inherited mutation. Which of the following is the cellular function of the mutated gene in this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Detect DNA errors at G1S and G2 M check point

questions.text: A know patient of sickle cell anemia presents with black discolouration of distal finger as shown in the image. True about the process are all except?

options.label: A
options.text: Black discolouration is due to Iron Sulfide at the site

options.label: B
options.text: Dense neutrophilic infiltrate will be seen on microscopy in black areas

options.label: C
options.text: Obstruction by sickle cells could be the cause

options.label: D
options.text: Microscopy will show maintained cellular outlines

questions.correct_answer: B. Dense neutrophilic infiltrate will be seen on microscopy in black areas

questions.text: A patient presents cough weight loss and hemoptysis. Imaging shows a lung tumor biopsy from lung carcinoma shows tumor cells positive for P40 and P63. Which of the following is likely to be manifestation in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Numbnesss and tingling as paraneoplastic manifestation

questions.correct_answer: A. Numbnesss and tingling as paraneoplastic manifestation

questions.text: A 61-year-old woman suffering from osteoporosis had been receiving alendronate and vitamin D supplementation for 2 years. Recent dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry showed a big decrease in bone density. The patient’s history was sig- nificant for a femur fracture 2 months earlier and a rib frac- ture 1 month earlier. Which of the following drugs is most likely to increase bone density in this patient?

A 57-year-old obese man was diagnosed with type 2 dia- betes mellitus. The patient had been suffering from chronic obstructive pulmonary disease for 5 years and from hyper- tension for 3 years. His current therapy included ipratropium and captopril. Which of the following antidiabetic drugs would be relatively contraindicated in this patient?

A 13-year-old boy recently diagnosed with asthma started a therapy that included inhaled fluticasone. Which of the following molecular actions most likely contributed to the therapeutic effect of the drug in the patient’s disease?

A 44-year-old man who has been receiving his first course of chemotherapy for a non-Hodgkin lymphoma still complains of recurrent nausea and vomiting despite antiemetic medi- cation with ondansetron, dexamethasone, and aprepitant. Which of the following drugs would be appropriate to add to the patient’s antiemetic regimen at this time?

A 66-year-old woman complained to her physician of bleed- ing gums. The woman had been receiving her third cycle of chemotherapy for metastatic ovarian cancer. A blood analy- sis showed the following results: red blood cell count 3.2 × 106/mm3 (normal, female 3.5?5.5 × 106/mm3), mean corpus- cular volume 96 fL (normal 80?100 fL), hemoglobin 9 g/dL (normal, female > 12 g/dL), neutrophil count 4600/mm3 (normal 3000?7000/mm3), platelet count 7000/mm3 (nor- mal 130,000?400,000/mm3). A hematopoietic agent was administered intravenously. Which of the following drugs would be appropriate for this patient?

A 22-year-old woman consulted her physician because of a postpartum breast infection. A Gram stain of the pus re- vealed gram-positive bacteria, and a susceptibility test showed resistance to all ?-lactam antibiotics. Which of the following bacteria was most likely the offending pathogen?

A 44-year-old woman complained of blurred vision and inability to distinguish green objects from red objects. The woman, recently diagnosed with cavitary pulmonary tuber- culosis, had been receiving a three-drug combination regi- men for 2 months. An eye examination indicated a narrowing of her visual field. Which of the following drugs most likely caused these adverse effects?

A 63-year-old woman recently diagnosed with onychomy- cosis started a treatment with terbinafine. Inhibition of which of the following enzymes most likely mediated the thera- peutic effect of the drug in the patient’s disease?

A 6-year-old hospitalized child complained of pain when urinating. A urine sample was cloudy and red. The child, di- agnosed with neuroblastoma, had begun a chemotherapy program 5 days earlier. Which of the following drugs most likely caused the patient’s symptoms?

A 57-year-old obese woman had low-density lipoprotein (LDL) cholesterol of 350 mg/dL (normal < 130 mg/dL) despite 3 months of therapy with lovastatin. The physician decided to add to the patient’s regimen a drug that acts by increasing the elimination of bile acids. Which of the following drugs was most likely prescribed?

A 6-month-old is male child is admitted for sinopulmonary infection. History reveals that he was suffering from the same type of infections twice. His pediatrician suspected an immune deficiency etiology and referred the child to a pediatric immunologist for further workup of recurrent sinopulmonary infections which have not abated despite adequate treatment. During the workup, flow cytometry demonstrates a decrease in normal CD40L cells. Based on these findings, the immunologist decides to pursue a further workup and obtains immunoglobulin levels. Which of the following immunoglobulin profiles is most likely to be observed in this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Increased IgM; Decreased IgG, IgA, IgE

questions.correct_answer: D. Increased IgM; Decreased IgG, IgA, IgE

questions.text: A 4-year-old girl is brought to the pediatrician after developing fever and a sore throat. The patient recently entered day care and similar symptoms have been reported in several of the other children. Physical examination shows exudative pharyngitis and enlarged anterior cervical lymph nodes as shown in the image. A rapid antigen detection test confirms the diagnosis of streptococcal throat infection. Her condition resolves with antibiotic therapy. Several weeks later. she is re-exposed to Streptococcus pyogenes. The bacteria penetrating beyond the surface epithelium are immediately A coated with preformed lgG antibodies. Which of the following substances acts in the most similar manner to lgG antibodies to facilitate phagocytosis?

A 6-year-old girl is brought to the emergency department because she has had a fever for 4 days, has begun vomiting after meals, and is suffering from a severe headache, irritability, and fatigue. Examination shows nuchal rigidity but no rash or conjunctivitis. A cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) sample is somewhat cloudy and has a white blood cell (WBC) count of 4/Cu.mm with a predominance of lymphocytes. The CSF glucose level is slightly low (60 mg), and the protein level is high (84mg). A Gram slain is negative. An infection with echovirus 11 is suspected. and the child recovers within 8 days without antibiotic treatment. Transmission from person to person of echovirus is facilitated by which viral characteristic?

A 51-year-old man seeks evaluation from his family physician with a complaint of heartburn, which has been gradually increasing over the last 10 years. The heartburn gets worse after eating spicy foods and improves with antacids. The past medical history is benign. He is a security guard and works long hours at night. He admits to smoking 1.5 packs of cigarettes every day. Upper gastrointestinal endoscopy reveals several gastric ulcers and regions of in?ammation. A biopsy is obtained, which revealed the pathogen, as shown in the micrograph below. This organism is associated with gastric adenocarcinoma. Which of the following bacterial products is responsible for neutralizing the acidity of the stomach?

An 18-year-old woman makes an appointment with a gynecologist for her ?rst gynecologic examination. She did not disclose her past medical history, but her sexual debut occurred with her boyfriend 3 weeks ago. She is now complaining of a yellow-green, diffuse, malodorous vaginal discharge that she noticed 1 week ago for the ?rst time. She also reported mild pelvic and abdominal pain, cervical motion tenderness was noted during the pelvic examination. The gynecologist also noticed a pink and in?amed nulliparous cervix with a preponderance of small red punctate spots as shown in the image. There was a frothy white discharge with a malodorous odor in the vaginal vault. A wet mount was prepared for a light microscopic examination, which revealed numerous squamous cells and motile organisms. The gynecologist concluded that this was a sexually transmitted infection. What is the Infective stage of this pathogen?

A 30-year-old man is brought to the emergency department with complaints of fever 106.7°F and diarrhea for the past 12 hours. There is no history of headaches, vomiting, or loss of consciousness. The past medical history is unobtainable due to a language barrier (the patient recently immigrated from Odisha), but his wife says that her husband had a motor vehicle accident when he was a teenager that required surgery. He is transferred to the ICU after a few hours in the ED because of dyspnea, cyanosis, and near collapse. There are no signs of a meningeal infection. The blood pressure was 70/30 mm Hg at the time of transfer. A chest X—ray at the time of admission showed interstitial in?ltrates without homogeneous opacities. The initial laboratory results reveal metabolic acidosis, leukopenia with a count of 2,000/mm3, thrombocytopenia (15,000/mm3), and a coagulation pro?le suggestive of disseminated coagulation. A peripheral smear was performed and is shown image. Despite ventilatory support. administration of intravenous fluids, antibiotics, and vasopressor agents, the patient died the next day. A Gram stain from an autopsy specimen of the lungs revealed gram-positive, Iancet-shaped diplococci occurring singly or in chains. How this infection could be prevented?

A 2 year-old boy is brought to a clinic with intermittent fevers and a rash for 6 days. According to his mother, he is also complaining of pain all over his body. She adds that the rash ?rst appeared on his face within 12 hours of the onset of fever, and later spread to his trunks and limbs. The patient denies any itchiness over the rash. There is no history of a sore throat or recent use of medication for symptom relief. His temperature is 37.2°C and the pulse is 88/min. On examination. there is a maculopapular rash on the face and the trunk, including the limbs, but sparing the palms and soles. The pediatrician reassures the mother that this is most likely a viral infection and will resolve spontaneously. After 7—10 days, the boy is brought back to the clinic for a follow-up visit. The areas affected by the rash appear to have a central clearing giving a lacy or reticular appearance as shown in the image. lgM antibody detection by ELISA will most likely detect antibodies against which of the following pathogens?

An 11-year-old boy presents with a sore throat. fever, chills, and dif?culty swallowing 6 for the past 3 days. The patient's mother says that last night he was short of breath and had a headache. Past medical history is unremarkable. The patient has not been vaccinated as his mother thinks it is "unnecessary". His temperature is 101.0°F, blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg. pulse is 110/min, and respiratory rate is 18/min. On physical examination, the patient is ill-appearing and dehydrated. There are a grayish-white membrane and pharyngeal erythema present in the oropharynx. Signi?cant cervical lymphadenopathy is present. A throat swab is taken, and gram stain shows gram-positive, club-shaped bacilli along with few neutrophils. Which of the following would most likely be the result of the bacterial culture of the throat swab in this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Hemolytic black colonies in blood agar

options.label: B
options.text: Bluish green colonies on Loef?er's serum

options.label: C
options.text: Metallic green colonies on eosin-methylene blue agar

questions.correct_answer: D. Greyish-white colonies on Thayer-Martin agar

questions.text: A 75-year-old man who underwent a bilateral lung transplant 11 months ago presented to the emergency room with fevers and chills. After the transplant procedure, he was immediately placed on immunosuppressive treatment; however, for unknown reasons he stopped taking the prophylactically prescribed voriconazole. Upon presentation to the emergency room. the patient was hypoxemic. Imaging revealed pulmonary nodules, which prompted a transbronchial biopsy for further evaluation. The results were negative for acute organ rejection, adenovirus, cytomegalovirus, and acid-fast bacilli. Slides stained with hematoxylin and eosin (H&E) revealed the pathogen. The specimen was sent to the microbiology laboratory for fungal culture, which resulted in the growth of a fuzzy mold on Sabouraud agar at 250C. A Lactophenol cotton blue preparation revealed the organism shown in the image. What organism has infected this patient?

A 29-year-old internal medicine resident reports to the emergency department with complaints of fevers, diarrhea. abdominal pain, and skin rash for 2 days. He feels fatigued and has lost his appetite. On further questioning, he says that he returned from his missionary trip to Brazil last week. He is excited as he talks about his trip. Besides a worthy clinical experience, he also enjoyed local outdoor activities, like swimming and rafting. His past medical history is insigni?cant. The blood pressure is 120/70 mm Hg, the pulse is 100lmin, and the temperature is 38.3°C. On examination, there is a rash on the legs. The rest of the examination is normal. Stool examination revealed the pathogen as shown in the image, Which of the following organisms is most likely responsible for this patient's a condition?
Not a feature of histopathological changes of electric burn is
All the following give rise to dimness of cornea before death EXCEPT
Match the age group for measles vaccination under different strategies:

options.label: A
options.text: A – I; B – II; C – III

options.label: B
options.text: A – II; B – I; C – II

options.label: C
options.text: A – II; B – I; C – III

options.label: D
options.text: A – I; B – III; C – II

questions.correct_answer: B. A – II; B – I; C – II

questions.text: A diphtheria patient came in contact with a person X. Mr. X has received primary immunization of 3 doses of DPT 3 years back. What line of intervention needs to be done for Mr. X?

options.label: D
options.text: Prophylactic Penicillin + full course of DPT

questions.text: A traveller is coming from Africa to India and has reached 6 days after he took yellow fever vaccination. You are the airport authority health officer. What will you do?

options.label: A
options.text: Send him back to Africa in next flight

options.label: B
options.text: Allow him to leave airport as IP is over

options.label: C
options.text: Keep him in mosquito free ward for next 4 days

options.label: D
options.text: Give him the vaccine again after doing antibody titre

questions.correct_answer: C. Keep him in mosquito free ward for next 4 days

questions.text: A lady who delivered a child on 20th May 2021 has received only 3000 rupees under PMMVY. When will she be eligible earliest to get her next 2000 rupees instalment?
Under PMSMY a lady is put under blue category. The disease she is suffering from is:

Chloroscope reading of a water sample is that it shows that it is having residual chlorine level of 1.2 ppm and the person testing the sample provides approval to the testing. This indicates that the water sample is most likely from:

options.label: C
options.text: Water from a well after the cyclone in Gujarat

options.label: D
options.text: Normal drinking water of any house

questions.text: Against which of the mosquito larvae does anti larvicidal show maximum action?
What is lacking in the diet of this young lady of 30 years of age who is unmarried and works in an IT firm?

options.label: D
options.text: She is taking all the three components as per required for her age and health status

questions.correct_answer: D. She is taking all the three components as per required for her age and health status

In this image which statistical parameter is same for all 3 images?

Which study design is depicted in the image?
The image shown below is a:

Which of the following images is the best site for measurement of skin fold thickness?

A previously healthy 32 years old female presented with rotatory vertigo associated with nausea and vomiting. The symptoms had started five days earlier as short lasting vertigo attacks, her symptoms had been continuous for three days. Clinical examination showed BP 200/95. Otoscopy was normal No nystagmus in a neutral position, and no pathological findings by standard clinical neurological examination was found. The next day the patient was still nauseated and described continuous vertigo, with a slight improvement. Hallpikes manoeuvre did not evoke nystagmus or exacerbation of her vertigo. Identify the investigation being done in the given image?
A 30 year old male is having Attic cholesteatoma of left ear with extradural abscess. Which of the following will be the operation of choice?

An elderly diabetic consults a physician because of severe and persistent earache. Otoscopic examination demonstrates foul-smelling purulent otorrhea and a red mass lesion of the external ear canal. Biopsy of the mass demonstrates granulation tissue rather than tumor. Which of the following is the most likely causative organism?

21 yrs old male patient with a one year history of development of nasal obstruction on the left with intermittent epistaxis in several opportunities, the latest episode of two days, accompanied by clear rhinorrhea, progressive decrease in olfaction, intermittent bilateral hearing loss at three months of development and weight loss of approximately 10 kg in one year. One examination palpation one lymph node of size 3 cm* 2cm at level III. On oral cavity examination palatal palsy was suspected. Choose the most appropriate diagnosis.

A 27-year-old female presented to the Otolaryngology department with a mass in the left nasal cavity. A gardner presents with itchy lesions on finger as show. The likely diagnosis is ( gt-7)

A 25-year-old man persistently believes that he is socially inept and fears negative evaluation by others. He seems to be timid and insecure. Which of the following personality disorders best describes this person?

options.label: D
options.text: Emotionally unstable personality disorder: borderline type

questions.text: A 24-year-old woman is referred by her obstetrician. She has an unplanned pregnancy and smokes marijuana 5 times per day. Her partner is concerned about effects of cannabis on the foetus. She avoids eye contact and appears anxious. She states that she eats and sleeps well. She emphasizes that she has a friend who delivered a healthy baby despite smoking cannabis throughout her pregnancy. Her partner is very keen to persuade her to quit cannabis. Which of the following best describes her current stage of change?

A 50-year-old man who presents with cirrhosis as a result of chronic alcohol dependence. During motivational interviewing, he defends his chronic drinking habit claiming that he needs alcohol to relax himself. He told his wife alcohol is good because he does not need to go out and that he saves money by drinking the whole day. Which of the following defence mechanisms does he manifest?

A 42 year old female presents with tingling and numbness in right hand that awakens her in the middle of the night for last two weeks. She also gives history of being treated for diabetes and hypothyroidism for last 3 years by an endocrinologist. Which of the following ain’t true about this condition from the following options ?

options.label: A
options.text: Splintage is helpful only in few initial months of onset of symptoms

options.label: B
options.text: Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

options.label: C
options.text: Durakn’s Test is the most specific clinical test in the diagnosis

options.label: D
options.text: It is the most common focal compression neuropathy

questions.correct_answer: B. Motor Symptoms appear early in the course of the disease

questions.text: An 8 year old child sustains fall from height while flying kite on the roof. He develops gross swelling over right ankle immediately. He is taken to a doctor whereby X rays were done which don’t show any bony fracture. The child is kept on conservative management. Two years later , the child develops Calcaneovalgus deformity of the ankle. What did we miss Two years ago ?
questions.correct_answer: A. Salter Harris V Physeal Trauma

questions.text: Identify the Test being done in the image below
Which of the following Implant terminology doesn’t match with its Mechanism of Action ?
questions.correct_answer: D. Steinmann’s Pin : Three Point Fixation

questions.text: A 7 year old boy is brought by parents to Ortho OPD with chief complains of dull aching pain and inability to squat. His problems started with intense pain in the right hip two weeks ago for which he was treated conservatively and symptomatically. His blood investigations show raised ESR with other counts almost normal. X rays were done which showed osteopenia and mild erosions around the hip joint mainly towards the acetabular side. Which of the following is the correct diagnosis ?

A 65 year old known COPD patient comes in emergency after being hit by a car.GCS of the patient is E1V2M3, and intubation is unanticipated difficult intubation. After intubation no ETCO2 is observed on monitor.reasons for this include all the following except:

options.label: C
options.text: Connection between ncircut and monitor gets disconnected

options.label: D
options.text: Patient had pneumothorax and high airway pressures are needed to adequately ventilate the patient.

questions.correct_answer: D. Patient had pneumothorax and high airway pressures are needed to adequately ventilate the patient.

questions.text: A rapid sequence induction is done on a patient having laparotomy. The patient is given 100 % oxygen @ 6 Litres /minute. Which of the following is most efficient circut for preoxygenation of this patient

A 50 year old female known case of type 2 diabetes for 15 years presented with complaints of fatique for many months. Her fasting plasma glucose is 180 mg/dl.She doesn’t take alcohol.She is taking metformin, atorvastatin and telmisartan.On examination she has acanthosis nigricans,xanthelsma with BMI 35.Her BP is 150/100 mmHg.Per abdomen examination revealed hepatomegaly 3 cm below costal margin.On Lab results there is high TG,high LDL,low HDL,SGPT 180 IU/L,serum bilirubin 1.8 mg/dl and serum ferritin is elevated. Which of the following statements about liver disease in the patient is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Statins should be discontinued due to the risk of drug-induced liver injury

options.label: C
options.text: The presence of individual features of the metabolic syndrome should be sought and treated to reduce cardiovascular risk

options.label: D
options.text: Venesection should be commenced immediately if ferritin levels are raised, as this indicates haemochromatosis

questions.correct_answer: C. The presence of individual features of the metabolic syndrome should be sought and treated to reduce cardiovascular risk

questions.text: A 12 year old boy is being investigated for fatigue. A physical examination, including blood pressure, is normal. Blood results show: sodium 135mmol/L, potassium 3.1mmol/L, bicarbonate 35mmol/L; 24-hour urine results: calcium 12mmol/24hrs (N < 7.5). What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 75-year-old patient presents to the ER after a syncopal episode. He is now alert and in retrospect describes occasional substernal chest pressure and shortness of breath on exertion. His blood pressure is 110/80 mm Hg and lungs have a few bibasilar rales.You are suspecting valvular heart disease.Which auscultatory finding would best explain his findings?

options.label: A
options.text: A harsh systolic crescendo-decrescendo murmur heard best at the upper right sternal border

options.label: B
options.text: A diastolic decrescendo murmur heard at the mid-left sternal border

options.label: C
options.text: A holosystolic murmur heard best at the apex with radiation to the axilla

questions.correct_answer: A. A harsh systolic crescendo-decrescendo murmur heard best at the upper right sternal border

questions.text: A 32-year-old Japanese woman has a long history of recurrent aphthous oral ulcers. In the past 2 months she has had recurrent genital ulcers. She now presents with a red painful eye that was diagnosed as anterior uveitis. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 43 year old woman attends the hospital accident and emergency department with a 1-hour history of sudden-onset severe occipital headache. On examination she is photophobic with neck stiffness. What is the most appropriate first-line investigation?

A 75 year old man with a past medical history of ischaemic heart disease is admitted to hospital following a fall at home. He becomes increasingly delirious on the ward. As part of his work-up, thyroid function is checked showing TSH 0.2mIU/L, free T4-2.04 ng/dL and free T3-0.21 ng/dL. What is the most appropriate management plan?

options.label: D
options.text: Repeat thyroid function tests when the patient has fully recovered

questions.correct_answer: D. Repeat thyroid function tests when the patient has fully recovered

questions.text: A 38 year old man with poorly controlled type 1 diabetes suddenly develops double vision. There is no history of fever,headache or vomiting.On examination he is unable to abduct his left eye.On neurological examination there is no other focal neurological deficit.He is well oriented and conscious. He undergoes an urgent CT scan of his brain, which is normal. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient with type 2 diabetes and hypertension develops Type 4 renal tubular acidosis as evident by blood pH 7.32,serum HCO3- 18 meq/L,serum K-5.9 meq/L. He is on ACE inhibitor, diuretic, aspirin low dose and vildagliptin. What is the most common pathophysiologic scenario leading to this acid-base disturbance?

options.label: A
options.text: The combination of long-standing diabetes and hypertension has led to distal nephron dysfunction inhibiting both acid and potassium secretion.

options.label: B
options.text: The patient has been overtreated with diuretics leading to intravascular volume depletion and acidosis.

options.label: C
options.text: The patient’s aspirin use has led to the metabolic acidosis.

options.label: D
options.text: The patient’s blood pressure has been overtreated with the combination of an ACE inhibitor causing renal hypoperfusion and the noted metabolic derangements.

questions.correct_answer: A. The combination of long-standing diabetes and hypertension has led to distal nephron dysfunction inhibiting both acid and potassium secretion.

questions.text: A 40 year old female, pure vegetarian presented with fatigue, numbness of feet and hands and knuckle skin changes as shown in the figure. There is pallor present.Lab reports- Hb 10.0 g/dl,MCV 112 fl.Peripheral smear showing macrocytes. Which deficiency will be the likely cause of this presentation?
Cannula are colour coded based on their gauge for easy identification. What is the gauge of the green color cannula.

A 50 year old male with medical history of type 2 diabetes for 8 years presented to you in OPD. He has no other previous medical history. But he is concerned about his kidneys as there is family history of chronic kidney disease in father which needed dialysis and ultimately renal transplant. He is asymptomatic otherwise. BP-126/80 mmHg, No other abnormality detected on physical examination. Which test will be useful for him to assess diabetes nephropathy

A 60 year old man presented with complaint of puffiness of face more in morning and decreases as day progresses for last 2 months.He also complaints of frothy urine.On examination facial swelling present,per abdomen- hepatosplenomegaly present.Lab results showed proteinuria of 8 g/d.Renal biopsy done which showed features of amyloidosis.All of the following can be the cause of his Amyloidosis except:

A 25 year old female presented with features suggestive of chronic inflammatory diarrhea. On further evaluation with colonic biopsy diagnosis of ulcerative colitis was made. She will have which extra intestinal manifestation more common as compared with Crohn’s disease?
Which of the following associations is recognized

options.label: A
options.text: Pulmonary plethora and pulmonary atresia with intact ventricular septum.

options.label: B
options.text: Prominent right heart border and ASD.

questions.correct_answer: B. Prominent right heart border and ASD.

questions.text: A previously healthy and active 72-year-old woman presents to your office with a complaint of stiffness and pain in her neck and shoulders. The symptoms are much worse in the morning and improve throughout the day. The pain affects the soft tissues and does not appear localized to the shoulder or hip joints. She denies headache or jaw claudication. Physical examination is unrevealing; there is no inflammatory synovitis, muscle tenderness, or skin rash. Muscle strength is normal in the deltoid and iliopsoas muscle groups. She has normal range of motion of the shoulder and hip joints. Laboratory studies reveal an elevated ESR of 92 mm/h and a mild normocytic anemia. Which of the following is the best next step in management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Empiric trial of prednisone 15 mg daily

questions.correct_answer: A. Empiric trial of prednisone 15 mg daily

questions.text: A 70-year-old man with chronic obstructive lung disease requires 2 L/min of nasal O2 to treat his hypoxia, which is sometimes associated with angina. The patient develops pleuritic chest pain, fever, and purulent sputum. While using his oxygen at an increased flow of 5 L/min, he becomes stuporous and develops a respiratory acidosis with CO2 retention and worsening hypoxia. What would be the most appropriate next step in the management of this patient?

options.label: D
options.text: Treat with antibiotics and observe on the general medicine ward for 24 hours

questions.correct_answer: C. Intubate and begin mechanical ventilation

questions.text: A 64-year-old woman presents with 6 weeks of fatigue, dyspnea, and night sweats. She has lost 5 kg weight. She has no history of trauma, has never had surgery, and takes no medications. Chest x-ray reveals a large right-sided pleural effusion. Thoracentesis yields pleural fluid that appears milky. Pleural fluid triglyceride level is 500 mg/dL. Which of the following disorders is most likely in this patient?

A 62-year-old automobile service worker presents with gradually worsening exertional dyspnea over the preceding several months. Recently, he has noticed right pleuritic chest pain. He has hypertension, well controlled on amlodipine 5 mg/d. He takes no other medications. He has never noticed cough or wheezing while at work. He worked for 15 years in construction and demolition and for 20 years thereafter in the service department of an automotive dealership. He denies fever, chills, or night sweats. On physical examination, he is in no respiratory distress but has right basilar dullness. His finger oximetry reads 96% on room air. Chest x-ray reveals a moderate right pleural effusion and lateral pleural thickening on both sides. Thoracentesis shows reddish fluid, which on formal analysis is an exudate with 45,000 RBCs/hpf. Cytology is negative. What is the most likely explanation for this patient’s symptoms?

options.label: C
options.text: Hypersensitivity pneumonitis due to thermophilic actinomycetes

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman presented with fatigue and dyspnea on exertion 1 month after her second vaginal delivery. Physical examination reveals a laterally displaced apical impulse, elevated jugular venous pressure, and pitting lower extremity edema. Echocardiogram shows systolic dysfunction with an ejection fraction of 30%. Which statement most accurately describes her condition?

options.label: A
options.text: This is a type of dilated cardiomyopathy

questions.correct_answer: A. This is a type of dilated cardiomyopathy

questions.text: An otherwise asymptomatic 65-year-old man with diabetes presents to the ER with a sports related right shoulder injury. His heart rate is noted to be irregular, and ECG is obtained (shown in the following figure). Which of the following is the best immediate therapy?

A 50 year old man with known case of rheumatic hear disease with mitral stenosis and mitral regurgitation developed fever for 3 weeks.He is complaining of palpitations and increasing dyspnea since then.On examination there are osler nodes,conjunctival petechie and Janeway lesion.Cardiac examination revealed LV S3,both pansystolic and middiastolic murmur at apex.Respiratory examination revealed bilateral crepts.ECHO showed oscillating mass lesion on mitral valve.Which of the following is an indication for surgical therapy in the patient?

options.label: A
options.text: An 8-mm vegetation is already indication for surgery

questions.correct_answer: D. The development of pulmonary edema

questions.text: A 35-year-old woman was recently diagnosed with systemic lupus erythematosus. She presents with progressive dyspnea and chest pain for 2 weeks. Jugular venous distension is present and heart sounds are muffled. ECG shows electrical alternans. Chest x-ray is shown in the following figure. Which of the following is the most likely additional physical finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Basilar rales halfway up both posterior lung fields

questions.text: A 50 year old man, farmer by occupation presented to emergency with complaints of excessive salivation, loose motions and increased frequency of urine for 2 days after he accidently had exposure of insecticide filled bag on his face while working in the field. He also complaint of visual blurring.He is developing dyspnea for 5-6 hours.On examination pulse rate is 50/minute,BP-90/60,pupils are constricted.Chest auscultation-bilateral ronchi.What will be the next immediate step

A 70 year old man with heavy alcohol intake developed dilated cardiomyopathy. He was started on ace inhibitors, carvedilol and digoxin. He didn’t get regular follow up and now presented with palpitations. Lab reports- elevated BUN and serum creatinine, serum K- 5.8 meq/L.His ECG is shown in figure.What is the likely cause of these ECG changes.

An intern working in a hepatitis ward accidently got needle stick injury from hepatitis B positive patient while taking a blood sample.Intern is vaccinated 5 years back during entry into medical college.His serum anti HbS levels are 50 mIU/ml.What will be done to prevent the risk of infection

options.label: A
options.text: Give booster dose of hepatitis vaccine

options.label: B
options.text: Entecavir to be started within 72 hours

options.label: C
options.text: Interferon to be started within 72 hours

questions.text: A 40 year old female consumed 20 tablets of aspirin after stressful event.Her husband took her to emergency department after 12 hours .On examination vitals are stable,per abdomen-epigastric tenderness present. Lab reports- blood pH 7.31, HCO3- 20 meq/L, PaCO2-36 mmHg,serum Na 145 meq/L,serum chloride-109,serum K-4.2 meq/L.What is the most likely acid base abnormality present

A 23 year old woman presents with 8-month history of bloating, loose stool and bowel-opening frequency of 3 times per day. There is no weight loss and no blood in stools. No history of fever. Blood tests reveal a haemoglobin of 10 g/dL, a ferritin of 7 µg/L(low) and a folate of 1 µg/L(low). What is the next best investigation?
